text: Ahhh okay. Maybe I was thinking there’s an easier way to do that but I guess not lmao thank you for the help!!

Thanks for the response! I guess my question is more specifically about flattening the image itself to fit the uv map like this photo? I’m a little familiar with texture paint but it seems very limited unless I’m just missing if there’s more options than brush, blender, average etc. srry im very new

#blender & #3dart ppl how do you flatten/unwrap an image around a model? 

I finally understand uv mapping a lil but not texture painting. Is there a free program like substance 3d, or should I screenshot the uvmap and paint over that in photoshop,etc??? Idk 😐
3d modeling pisses me off bc why tf I gotta take a cube and make it sphere instead of just loading a sphere

Doodle :3

#blender #3dart #3dmodelling #characterdesign
Like for thing guy I wanted to add sci fi tubes in the head dents, and screws in the red leather dents. But my dumbass did vertex paint for an hour and lost motivation for everything else 😐
I guess a better way to ask is like should I be making drafts or sketches before starting 3d or am I doing things fine and just need more practice lmao

Anyone have tips on improving blender workflow? How much time should I be committing to low poly features instead of jumping straight to fine details? I feel like I’m too eager to remesh/subdivide, and my designs end up much more plain than I imagined, or I lose motivation :/ #blender #blender3d
This is awesome! I’m very new to blender and honestly the most confusing thing so far is shading/textures but I wanna make scenes like this so bad
